property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: U.S. Army and Air Force personnel and local children stretching before a soccer game

note.text: Foreign intervention in Afghanistan from the 19th century to the present day has led Afghans to regard Westerners with a great deal of suspicion. Some civilian Afghans view the American presence as a threat to their culture and way of living. Others, including some in the Afghan government and military, welcome American support and experience, and work with U.S. officials toward a more stable Afghanistan.
Don't assume that all Afghans will have the same perspective. Remember, showing legitimate concern for your counterparts' challenges will be the basis of your working relationships.
